alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie; Mainland Southern Brevard; Okeechobee; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern St. Lucie, northern Okeechobee, Indian River, southeastern Brevard and southeastern Osceola Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Drum, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Sebastian, Vero Beach, Fellsmere and Indian River Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
